*div1 type="summary"* *p*Oliver P. Jackson to Austin, New Orleans, February 10, 1833. Asking information about Texas, and prospects for practice of law.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-10-1833">February. 10th 1833*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*I presume to address you on a subject which has occupied, more or less my attention for the last two years, viz, a permanent residence in the *location_mentioned*Texas Country*/location_mentioned*. Circumstances have prevented me from carrying my wishes into effect thus far, and being now at *location_mentioned*N. Orleans */location_mentioned*where I have been residing for the *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1832">last three months*/date_mentioned*, my wishes strongly combining with the facility of reaching the *location_mentioned*Spanish Country*/location_mentioned*, prompt me to carry my desire into effect. When I left *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned* where my life thus far has been passed, to visit this place, I was induced to believe from representations made me, that I should find a lucrative practice in the profession of the Law in this city. Altho I may not perhaps have given it fully a fair experiment, yet a strong desire to live in a climate less fatal, and a country, less expensive, as my means are limited, induce me to seek *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*as a country more congenial in most respects to my wishes, and I flatter myself to my future prospects in life also. Had I have determined upon settling in your *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, when I left*location_mentioned* N York*/location_mentioned*, I should have brought to you introductory letters from your *person_mentioned*cousin*/person_mentioned*, I believe, with whom I am well acquainted, having boarded with him upwards of a year—I mean the *person_mentioned*Mr. Austin*/person_mentioned*, who is with a *person_mentioned*Mr. Harmony, a Spanish Merchant of *location_mentioned*N York*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*— *person_mentioned*Mr. A.*/person_mentioned* has told me that he intended settling in the *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*soon himself. *person_mentioned*Mr. Meigs*/person_mentioned* family of *location_mentioned*N York*/location_mentioned*, (whom I have often heard speak of you and *person_mentioned*Cap. Austin*/person_mentioned*,) I am intimately acquainted— I presume you were formerly acquainted with my Father, *person_mentioned*Amasa Jackson*/person_mentioned*, who married the daughter of *person_mentioned*Oliver Phelps of *location_mentioned*Suffield, Connecticut*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*. My *person_mentioned*Father */person_mentioned*was for many years a *person_mentioned*Merchant*/person_mentioned* in *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned*, and became unfortunate a short time before his death which happened about seven years ago. Should your answer to this communication be at all favourable, so as to justify my visiting your *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, I will endeavor to visit it immediately, and will bring with me from this place such letters as will be satisfactory to you. I have mentioned the above, thro, fear that you may [receive] many applications of this sort, from *person_mentioned*worthless persons*/person_mentioned*, as the idea is somewhat prevalent that the *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*is resorted to by those, and those only from the *location_mentioned*U States,*/location_mentioned* who are ruined in property and character. To be candid with you Sir, I would say, that I am poor—, willingly, ardently willing to engage in any honourable occupation for a livelihood. Misfortune has hitherto attended my steps, and being yet in the meridian of life, I am very solicitous in your new and rising colony, to lay the foundation for future success and happiness. If you can afford toe the least gleam of hope, I will embrace it with eagerness and will endeavour to the extent of my limited ability to promote the interests of your *location_mentioned*flourishing colony*/location_mentioned* in every practicable manner—*/p*
*p*May I then request you, Sir, to address me at this place as soon as may be practicable, imparting to me such information in reference to my locating in your *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, that I may act upon it with due deliberation. Naught, but the most serious obstacles will prevent me from becoming a *person_mentioned*resident */person_mentioned*of that land, so that I feel myself prepared to suffer many trying inconveniences. I have attended to my profession, which has been that of the Law, tho I have had in the last few years experience in mercantiling pursuits-— I am now engaged in the *person_mentioned*profession of Law*/person_mentioned* in this place. I shall await the recpt. of your Letter with some impatience, and I must again beg you to excuse the liberty— I have taken in troubling you on this subject.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Oliver P. Jackson*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col. Stephen Austin */person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Felippe Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
